attributes.action: BBC reporting biased towards EU Referendum In campaign
attributes.additional_details:
Whenever there is a speech for the "In" side it is covered in detail and invariably is headline news. Or when there is an opinion from big business or the IMF for example it is big news.

For example there was a speech by both Mr Cameron and Mr Johnson yet the BBC website mentions both but the main image on the page is of Mr Cameron's speech.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36289037

The section "EU referendum campaign live" only mentions a comment from the World Bank.
attributes.background:
Currently I'm an undecided voter with regards to the EU Referendum campaign so have an open mind towards both sides of the argument.

Is it me or does it seem that the BBC's reporting is biased towards the "In" campaign.

rejection.details:
The BBC's content is independent of the Government and Parliament. If you want to make a complaint about BBC reporting, you can find out about the BBC complaints system here:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/bbctrust/our_work/complaints_and_appeals/
